notes: Compact sedan (1989-1995). Chrysler AA platform. Shared with Dodge Spirit. Replaced by Breeze. Data sourced from Wikipedia Plymouth Acclaim article, January 2025 revision.
Sports coupe (1990-1994). Rebadged Eagle Talon/Mitsubishi Eclipse. Diamond-Star Motors. Turbo AWD available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Plymouth Laser article, January 2025 revision.
Compact car (1987-1994). Chrysler P platform. Dodge Shadow twin. Turbo variant available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Plymouth Sundance article, January 2025 revision.
Second generation minivan (1991-1995). Chrysler AS platform. Short and long wheelbase. AWD available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Plymouth Voyager article, January 2025 revision.
Third generation minivan (1996-2000). Chrysler NS platform. Shared with Dodge Caravan. Data sourced from Wikipedia Plymouth Voyager article, January 2025 revision.
Extended wheelbase Voyager (1996-2000). Chrysler NS platform. Long-wheelbase variant. Data sourced from Wikipedia Plymouth Voyager article, January 2025 revision.
First generation compact (1995-1999). Chrysler PL platform. Dodge/Plymouth shared. Expresso coupe available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Plymouth Neon article, January 2025 revision.
Retro hot rod roadster (1997-2002). Aluminum space frame. Limited production. 253 hp from 1999+. No manual transmission. Data sourced from Wikipedia Plymouth Prowler article, January 2025 revision.
Compact sedan (1996-2000). Chrysler JA platform. Shared with Dodge Stratus/Chrysler Cirrus. Data sourced from Wikipedia Plymouth Breeze article, January 2025 revision.
